title: WhatsApp will renew reactions to messages: first clues from the latest beta for iOS – TuttoTech
text:
WhatsApp ‘s New Beta Update: Emoji Me Up, Scotty! So, folks, it seems that WhatsApp is at it again! The WhatsApp team has rolled out a splendid new beta update for iOS via the TestFlight beta program, bringing the application to version 24.21.10.76 . What’s cooking in the WhatsApp kitchen this time? Well, it appears they’re stirring the pot to cook up some delicious innovations for message reactions. And let’s just say, if you’re one of those people who can’t live without your emojis, this news is about to make you grin wider than a Cheshire cat who just found a lifetime supply of cream!
New Reactions on the Horizon! Now, before we dive deeper into these juicy details, let’s remind ourselves that despite our intense love affair with WhatsApp, we’re still waiting for a proper app for the iPad. I mean, c’mon, WhatsApp! Some of us need a little more screen real estate to showcase our hysterical meme-sharing prowess! If you’re like me and prefer to chat while sitting in a stylish café, let’s hope they’re working on something fabulous. In the meantime, the iOS update promises to enhance a feature we had a delightful chat about back in the day — the reaction emojis to your messages. Oh, the anticipation!
What’s the big news, you ask? Well, let me break it down for you like a discount DJ at a wedding. Currently, when you react to a message, you’re stuck with a static reaction bar featuring six fixed emojis and that old “+” button for all the others—like your inexperienced buddy who can only juggle two balls. Boring, right? But fear not! The WhatsApp team has been busy (probably fueled by caffeine and despair!) and is working on a fantastic new sliding reaction bar that will allow you to select your most recent emojis in a blink. Talk about instant gratification!
Imagine a world where you can respond to your mate’s dad joke with a perfectly poised poop emoji — no scrolling, no fuss, just emoji excellence at your fingertips! This delightful upgrade has already been spotted in the Android beta channel, so it’s only fair that iOS users get a taste of this emoji revolution, right?
What’s Next for WhatsApp? Stay Tuned! But hold your horses; this feature is still in development! So, for now, we’re left hanging like a badly constructed punchline. But don’t worry! If you’re the impatient type (and let’s face it, who isn’t these days?), we’ve whipped up a handy guide on how to download WhatsApp Beta on iOS and Android so you can get the inside scoop before your friends!
So, whether you’re a “thumbs-up” kind of person or someone who expresses feelings via a dramatically exaggerated facepalm emoji, stay tuned! WhatsApp is working tirelessly — presumably not from a beach umbrella, but rather from their offices — to deliver what we need. So, keep your eyes peeled for updates, and for heaven’s sake, make sure to follow the news on WhatsApp, unless you want to be the last person in the world to find out about your brand new favorite thumb emoji!
For the latest gossipy updates and features, don’t forget to hop onto our official WhatsApp channel and keep your emoji game strong!
In the past few hours, the WhatsApp team has released a new one beta update for iOS via the TestFlight beta Program bringing the application to version 24.21.10.76 and anticipating the future introduction of an interesting innovation in the functioning of reactions to messages. The novelty in question is under development and will be introduced with a future update of the app, but this does not prevent us from discovering it in preview.
Before going into the merits of the news in question, we remind you that you can find all the latest news on the most famous messaging app in the world – such as, for example, the one relating to the customization of the themes of the various chats – in our pages dedicated to WhatsApp per Android and to WhatsApp for iOS and Desktop.
WhatsApp working to improve reactions to messages If on the one hand there is still no trace of the dedicated app for iPad, on the other the WhatsApp team continues to work assiduously on the one for iOS and the latest update released for the beta branch of the service resumes a function we had talked about in unsuspecting times for the Android world: work is underway for renew reactions to messages by highlighting recent emoji .
In short, through this new operating mechanism, the WhatsApp team wants to ensure that, when reacting to a message, users have immediate access to the most frequently used emoji. Already spotted in the beta channel for Android, therefore, the novelty in question is also being developed for WhatsApp Beta for iOS, as can be seen from the sighting in the update 24.21.10.76. The following screenshot clearly highlights that, while at present the reaction bar includes six fixed predefined emojis (and the “+” button to choose from all the others), in the future the bar will become sliding and users will be able to select recent emoji more quickly . This should give greater comfort and flexibility to reactions.
As mentioned at the beginning, the novelty described is still in the development phase; We will update you as soon as it is made available. In case, however, you are eager to preview the new features offered through the beta program, we have created a guide on how to download WhatsApp Beta on iOS and Android.
Finally, we remind you that to stay updated on all the news, you can also follow us on our official WhatsApp channel .
